required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Gait Parameters and Their Impact on Postoperative Recovery in Patients With Lumbar Spinal Stenosis: a Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Gait Parameters and Their Impact on Postoperative Recovery in Patients With Lumbar Spinal Stenosis: a Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The first aim is to evaluate the integration's feasibility of a research project linked to the walking parameters into the clinical process pre and postoperative for patient with lumbar spinal stenosis who consult in neurosurgery. The second objective is to observe the evolution of walking parameters during the surgery process and find which of all calculated walking parameters represent the best indicators of functional disabilities and postoperative recovery for patient with lumbar spinal stenosis.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline French-Canadian adaptation of Swiss Spinal Stenosis Questionnaires (FC-SSSQ)
primary_outcome.description: pain, function and satisfaction related to lumbar spinal stenosis. Pain subscale score range from 7 to 35 with higher values indicate a worst outcome, Function subscale score range from 5 to 20 with higher values indicate a worst outcome, Satisfaction subscale score range from 6 to 24 with higher values indicate a worst outcome. The total score is composed of the three subscales and range from 18 to 79.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Quality of life (EuroQol - 5D)
primary_outcome.description: Quality of life related to mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain and discomfort, anxiety and depression. Each category has a score ranging from 1 to 3 and higher values indicate a worst outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ)
primary_outcome.description: physical activity habits. IPAQ score range from 1 to 3 where a score of 3 indicates a higher practice of physical activity
Time participants take to do the walking task in seconds
the walking stride velocity (meter/second) is the mean speed of forward walking, calculated in meters per second
Gait cycle (% stance phase, % swing phase)
Stride Length [m] describes the distance between two successive footprints on the ground, from the heel of a foot to the heel of the same foot, one cycle after.

secondary_outcome.description: Swing Width (m) is the maximal lateral excursion of the foot during swing phase. It is the maximum lateral distance between the forward path and the real path of the foot.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline Minimal To Clearance
secondary_outcome.description: Min. Toe Clearance (meter) is the minimum height of the toes during swing phase.

intervention.description: 30 meters walking task (15 meters round trip) following by a rest period of 2 minutes. Participants are invited to perform the 30 meters walking task twice. Inertial sensors are put on each participant foot.

study_pop.textblock: Patients older than 18 years old with lumbar spinal stensois

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with lumbar spinal stenosis
- Presenting neurogenic claudication
- Waiting for a surgery (laminectomy, laminotomy, fusion)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Symptomatic hip or knee osteoarthritis
